GENERAL.FURTHERINFORMATION: A ~b~backup officer~w~ has pulled over a vehicle and is requesting another unit to provide backup during the stop.

DIALOGUES.DIALOGUE: ~b~Officer: ~w~Hello m'am, do you know why I stopped you today?
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello sir, do you know why I stopped you today?
~r~Suspect: ~w~No, what's wrong? I thought I was driving fine.
~b~Officer: ~w~You were driving all over the place, couldn't stay in one lane.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Oh, I didn’t even realize. Was it really that bad?
~b~Officer: ~w~Yes, I had to follow you for a bit to make sure. It looked like you were struggling to keep control.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Sorry officer, I am not a hugely confident driver.
~b~Officer: ~w~Have you had your license for very long?
~r~Suspect: ~w~Yes, I just don't drive very often. I'm sorry, I've been trying to improve. I just find it stressful.
~b~Officer: ~w~You've got to be very careful, you can't swerve between lanes all the time, there are other road users.
~b~Officer: ~w~If you're feeling nervous, take your time and focus on staying centered in your lane.
~b~Officer: ~w~I'm going to let you go with a warning, but I don't want to see you driving like that again.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Thank you officer! I appreciate the second chance. Have a good day!
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello m'am, do you know why I stopped you today?
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello sir, do you know why I stopped you today?
~r~Suspect: ~w~Was I going too fast, officer?
~b~Officer: ~w~You were going just above the speed limit, you need to be careful.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Oh, I didn’t notice. How much over was I?
~b~Officer: ~w~Not by much, but enough that it caught my attention.
~r~Suspect: ~w~I'm sorry officer, I think I missed the speed sign.
~b~Officer: ~w~That can't happen again. Do you have a valid license?
~r~Suspect: ~w~Yes officer. This is the first time I've been stopped before.
~b~Officer: ~w~Alright, I’ll check your license and run a quick record check. Sit tight.
~b~Officer: ~w~Okay well your license looks good so I'll let you be on your way, let this serve as a warning to you though.
~r~Suspect: ~w~I'm sorry, I will be more careful!
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello m'am, do you know why I stopped you today?
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello sir, do you know why I stopped you today?
~r~Suspect: ~w~No, did I do something wrong?
~b~Officer: ~w~Your brake light is out. That can be dangerous, especially at night.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Oh no, I had no idea! How bad is it?
~b~Officer: ~w~It's completely out, no light at all when you brake. Have you had any maintenance done recently?
~r~Suspect: ~w~Not in a while, to be honest. I've been meaning to get a check-up done.
~b~Officer: ~w~I recommend getting it fixed as soon as possible. Other drivers need to see when you're stopping.
~b~Officer: ~w~Do you have a repair shop nearby you trust?
~r~Suspect: ~w~Not really, but I can look one up.
~b~Officer: ~w~Good. I'm not going to give you a ticket, but take this as a warning. Get that light fixed soon.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Absolutely, officer. Thank you for letting me know, I'll take care of it!
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello m’am, do you know why I pulled you over today?
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello sir, do you know why I pulled you over today?
~r~Suspect: ~w~Uh… no? Everything alright?
~b~Officer: ~w~You failed to signal when changing lanes back there. That can be dangerous, especially with how heavy traffic is today.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Oh, I didn’t even realize! I must’ve been focused on merging.
~b~Officer: ~w~I understand that, but it’s important to make sure other drivers know what you’re doing. It’s for everyone’s safety.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Yeah, I get that. I’ll make sure to signal from now on.
~b~Officer: ~w~Good. It only takes a second to use your turn signal, and it could prevent accidents.
~b~Officer: ~w~Do you usually drive in heavy traffic?
~r~Suspect: ~w~Not usually, but I was trying to get ahead of some slow-moving vehicles today.
~b~Officer: ~w~Alright, I’m not issuing a ticket today, just a warning. I trust this will be a reminder to be more mindful of your signals.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Absolutely! Thanks for letting me off with a warning, officer.
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello ma'am, do you know why I stopped you today?
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello sir, do you know why I stopped you today?
~r~Suspect: ~w~Um… was I going too fast?
~b~Officer: ~w~No, but you didn’t stop at the stop sign back there.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Oh no… I’m so sorry. I must not have seen it.
~b~Officer: ~w~It’s important to be aware—rolling through a stop can be dangerous.
~r~Suspect: ~w~I understand. I should’ve been paying more attention.
~b~Officer: ~w~I have to issue you a citation for the violation.
~r~Suspect: ~w~I get it. I’ll be more careful next time.
~b~Officer: ~w~Drive safe, and make sure to stop fully at all signs.
~r~Suspect: ~w~I will. Thank you, officer.
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello m'am, do you know why I stopped you today?
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello sir, do you know why I stopped you today?
~r~Suspect: ~w~I have no idea, was I speeding?
~b~Officer: ~w~No, but I ran your plate, and your vehicle registration is expired.
~r~Suspect: ~w~What? That’s impossible, I thought I renewed it.
~b~Officer: ~w~According to the system, it expired last month. Have you received a renewal notice?
~r~Suspect: ~w~I mean... maybe? I get so much mail, I must have missed it.
~b~Officer: ~w~Unfortunately, I have to issue you a citation for the expired registration.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Great... just what I needed.
~b~Officer: ~w~You’ll need to get it renewed as soon as possible. Instructions are on the ticket.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Fine. Guess I’ll deal with it.
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello m'am, do you know why I stopped you today?
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello sir, do you know why I stopped you today?
~r~Suspect: ~w~No, but I’m sure you’re going to tell me.
~b~Officer: ~w~I saw you using your phone while driving. That’s a serious safety issue.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Oh, come on! I was just checking my GPS for a second.
~b~Officer: ~w~It doesn’t matter. The law is clear—no handheld devices while driving.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Seriously? There are way worse things happening, and this is what you’re worried about?
~b~Officer: ~w~Distracted driving leads to accidents. I’m issuing you a citation.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Unbelievable. This is just a cash grab.
~b~Officer: ~w~You have the right to contest the ticket in court if you disagree. Drive safe.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Yeah, whatever.
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello ma'am, do you know why I stopped you today?
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello sir, do you know why I stopped you today?
~r~Suspect: ~w~Um, I’m not sure… maybe for speeding?
~b~Officer: ~w~No, but you didn’t signal when you changed lanes back there.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Oh, I didn’t realize. I’m sorry about that.
~b~Officer: ~w~It’s important to signal—it keeps everyone on the road safe.
~r~Suspect: ~w~I know, I’ll be more careful next time.
~b~Officer: ~w~I’m issuing you a citation for failing to signal.
~r~Suspect: ~w~I understand. I’ll make sure to signal every time.
~b~Officer: ~w~You can pay the fine online, and be more mindful of your signals in the future.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Thank you, officer. I’ll definitely pay more attention.
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello ma'am, do you know why I stopped you today?
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello sir, do you know why I stopped you today?
~r~Suspect: ~w~No, I don’t. Was I driving too slow?
~b~Officer: ~w~No, but you were tailgating the vehicle in front of you. It’s a safety hazard.
~r~Suspect: ~w~I wasn’t tailgating! They were going way too slow!
~b~Officer: ~w~That may be, but following too closely can cause accidents. It’s important to maintain a safe distance.
~r~Suspect: ~w~I was just trying to get to work, I wasn’t thinking about it that much.
~b~Officer: ~w~I understand, but for your safety and others’, I have to issue you a citation for tailgating.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Great… just what I needed.
~b~Officer: ~w~Make sure to maintain a safe distance from now on. Drive safely.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Yeah, whatever.
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello m'am, do you know why I stopped you today?
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello sir, do you know why I stopped you today?
~r~Suspect: ~w~Not sure, was I speeding?
~b~Officer: ~w~No, but when I ran your information, it came back that your license is suspended.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Wait, that’s a mistake. I sorted that out weeks ago!
~b~Officer: ~w~The system still shows it as suspended. You’re not supposed to be driving.
~r~Suspect: ~w~This is ridiculous, I can’t afford another ticket. I need my car for work!
~b~Officer: ~w~I understand that, but you can’t drive on a suspended license.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Come on, officer, there’s got to be another way to handle this.
~b~Officer: ~w~I need you to step out of the vehicle while we sort this out.
~r~Suspect: ~w~No way! I’m not getting out over some stupid clerical error!
~b~Officer: ~w~I’m not going to ask you again. Step out now.
~r~Suspect: ~w~You know what? Forget this!
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello m'am, do you know why I stopped you today?
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello sir, do you know why I stopped you today?
~r~Suspect: ~w~No, but I bet you’re gonna tell me.
~b~Officer: ~w~Your brake light is out. You need to get that fixed.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Oh… that’s all? Thought you were pulling me for something else.
~b~Officer: ~w~Do you have anything illegal in the vehicle?
~r~Suspect: ~w~What? No! I mean… nothing serious.
~b~Officer: ~w~What do you mean, nothing serious? I need you to be honest with me.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Look, I got a weapon under the seat, but it’s just for protection!
~b~Officer: ~w~The owner of this vehicle doesn’t have a gun license. I need you to step out of the vehicle.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Come on, seriously?! It’s not even a big deal!
~b~Officer: ~w~Out of the car. Now.
~r~Suspect: ~w~No way, I’m not going to jail over this!
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello m'am, do you know why I stopped you today?
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello sir, do you know why I stopped you today?
~r~Suspect: ~w~Nope, but I’m sure you have some excuse.
~b~Officer: ~w~I noticed you were weaving between lanes back there. Have you been drinking tonight?
~r~Suspect: ~w~What? No! That’s ridiculous. I’m just tired.
~b~Officer: ~w~Your eyes are bloodshot, and I can smell alcohol. I need you to step out of the vehicle for a sobriety test.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Oh, so now I’m a drunk? Come on, officer, I’m telling you, I’m just tired.
~b~Officer: ~w~Step out of the car. Now.
~r~Suspect: ~w~You know what? No. I’m not doing this.
~b~Officer: ~w~Don’t make this harder than it needs to be. Step out of the vehicle.
~r~Suspect: ~w~I don’t think so, officer.
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello ma'am, do you know why I stopped you today?
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello sir, do you know why I stopped you today?
~r~Suspect: ~w~I’m not sure, officer. Was I speeding?
~b~Officer: ~w~No, but your vehicle’s registration is expired, and I need to check your ID.
~r~Suspect: ~w~I paid for the registration! There’s no way it's expired!
~b~Officer: ~w~I’ll need you to step out so we can resolve this.
~r~Suspect: ~w~I can’t deal with this right now!
~b~Officer: ~w~I need you to stay calm and step out of the vehicle.
~r~Suspect: ~w~I can’t. I just… I’m sorry!
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello ma'am, do you know why I stopped you today?
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello sir, do you know why I stopped you today?
~r~Suspect: ~w~No, officer. What’s the issue?
~b~Officer: ~w~I pulled you over because your brake lights are malfunctioning. I need to check your ID.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Are you kidding me? That’s it?
~b~Officer: ~w~It’s a safety issue. I need to ensure you’re good to drive.
~r~Suspect: ~w~This is ridiculous!
~b~Officer: ~w~Please hand me your license and registration.
~r~Suspect: ~w~I don’t have time for this!
~b~Officer: ~w~Quick! Get back to our patrol vehicles and catch the bugger!
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello ma'am, do you know why I stopped you today?
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello sir, do you know why I stopped you today?
~r~Suspect: ~w~No clue. What’s the problem?
~b~Officer: ~w~Your vehicle matches the description of one reported in a nearby incident. I need your ID.
~r~Suspect: ~w~That’s crazy! I’ve been home all night!
~b~Officer: ~w~Your plates were spotted in the area. Hand me your ID.
~r~Suspect: ~w~You’re harassing me for NO REASON! This is BULLSHIT!
~b~Officer: ~w~Step out of the vehicle. Now.
~r~Suspect: ~w~I’M NOT GOING ANYWHERE! YOU HAVE NO RIGHT!
~b~Officer: ~w~Last chance. Step out of the vehicle, or I’ll remove you.
~r~Suspect: ~w~GET THE HELL AWAY FROM ME! I’M DONE WITH THIS!
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello ma'am, do you know why I stopped you today?
~b~Officer: ~w~Hello sir, do you know why I stopped you today?
~r~Suspect: ~w~Yeah, because some idiot called the cops over NOTHING.
~b~Officer: ~w~We received a report that you were aggressively tailgating and swerving at another driver.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Oh, so now I’M the bad guy? THAT MORON CUT ME OFF FIRST!
~b~Officer: ~w~Reckless driving is a serious offense. I need to see your license.
~r~Suspect: ~w~FOR WHAT?! I DIDN’T EVEN TOUCH THEIR CAR!
~b~Officer: ~w~Sir, hand over your license. Now.
~r~Suspect: ~w~THIS IS BULLSHIT! YOU'RE JUST LOOKING FOR A REASON TO SCREW ME OVER!
~b~Officer: ~w~Step out of the vehicle. Now.
~r~Suspect: ~w~I’M NOT DOING A DAMN THING! GET AWAY FROM ME!
~b~Officer: ~w~Ma’am, where are you headed?
~b~Officer: ~w~Sir, where are you headed?
~r~Suspect: ~w~What’s with all the questions? I’m just driving.
~b~Officer: ~w~I need to confirm a few things. Whose vehicle is this?
~r~Suspect: ~w~Mine! What kinda question is that?
~b~Officer: ~w~That’s interesting, because this vehicle is registered to a female.
~b~Officer: ~w~That’s interesting, because this vehicle is registered to a male.
~r~Suspect: ~w~WHAT?! That’s bull! You must’ve messed something up!
~b~Officer: ~w~The system doesn't make mistakes. Who does this car belong to?
~r~Suspect: ~w~I told you, it’s MINE! This is a waste of time!
~b~Officer: ~w~I need you to step out of the vehicle. Now.
~r~Suspect: ~w~HELL NO! YOU’RE NOT TAKING ME IN FOR THIS!
~b~Officer: ~w~I'M UNDER FIRE! SHE'S GOT A WEAPON, BE CAREFUL!
~b~Officer: ~w~I'M UNDER FIRE! HE'S GOT A WEAPON, BE CAREFUL!
~b~Officer: ~w~WE NEED TO TAKE DOWN THE SUSPECT! GIVE ME COVERING FIRE!
~b~Officer: ~w~Jesus Christ...that was quite something!
~b~Officer: ~w~You came in the nick of time, thank you!
~b~Officer: ~w~Thank you for arriving officer. I've stopped this vehicle and wanted some backup before proceeding.
~b~You: ~w~No worries, what would you like me to do?
~b~Officer: ~w~I'd like you to stay in your patrol vehicle while I conduct the stop, in case the vehicle makes off.
~b~You: ~w~Sounds good, lets go.
~b~Officer: ~w~Good to see you, officer. This one's giving me a weird vibe, so I’d rather have backup before I approach.
~b~You: ~w~Understood. What’s the plan?
~b~Officer: ~w~Stay in your vehicle and be ready in case they decide to run. I’ll handle the stop.
~b~You: ~w~Got it. Let’s see how this plays out.
~b~Officer: ~w~Thanks for coming. Just a heads-up, I don’t want to escalate things, so I’ll keep this low-key.
~b~You: ~w~Got it. You want me to hang back?
~b~Officer: ~w~Yeah, stay in your vehicle and keep an eye on things. If something feels off, be ready.
~b~You: ~w~Understood. I’ll be watching.
~b~Officer: ~w~Glad you're here. I’d feel better with another set of eyes on this.
~b~You: ~w~Alright, where do you need me?
~b~Officer: ~w~Come up on the passenger side while I speak with the driver. Just in case things take a turn.
~b~You: ~w~Copy that. Let’s go.
~b~Officer: ~w~Something feels off about this one. Appreciate you showing up.
~b~You: ~w~No problem. What do you need?
~b~Officer: ~w~I will speak with the driver; you should approach from the passenger side. Less of a direct threat if things go south.
~b~You: ~w~Alright, I’m with you.
~b~Officer: ~w~Hey, thanks for coming. I’d rather not do this alone.
~b~You: ~w~I hear you. Where do you need me?
~b~Officer: ~w~Take position on the driver side with me. Let’s keep this straightforward.
~b~You: ~w~Alright, let’s handle it.
~b~Officer: ~w~Appreciate the quick response. I want this driver to know they’ve got eyes on them.
~b~You: ~w~Understood. Where do you want me?
~b~Officer: ~w~Stand on the driver’s side with me. A little extra presence never hurts.
~b~You: ~w~Sounds good. Let’s do it.
~b~Officer: ~w~Thanks for backing me up. You can stay in your vehicle for now, or join me up front—your call.
~b~You: ~w~Alright, I’ll decide based on how this plays out.
~b~Officer: ~w~Sounds good. Just be ready if I need you.
~b~You: ~w~I got you covered.
~b~Officer: ~w~Hey, glad you're here. With how traffic stops have been going lately, I didn’t want to approach alone.
~b~You: ~w~Understood. What’s the plan?
~b~Officer: ~w~I want you at the passenger side while I talk to the driver. Just in case.
~b~You: ~w~Alright, let’s be smart about this.
~b~Officer: ~w~Hey, uh… thanks for showing up. I’m still getting used to doing stops alone.
~b~You: ~w~No problem. You got a plan?
~b~Officer: ~w~Yeah, I just feel better having backup. You can either stay in your car or join me at the driver’s side. Your call.
~b~You: ~w~Got it. I’ll be ready.
~b~Officer: ~w~Appreciate the backup officer! Have a good rest of your shift!
~b~Officer: ~w~Thanks sir, I appreciate you coming to assist with that stop.
~b~Officer: ~w~Thanks m'am, I appreciate you coming to assist with that stop.
~b~Officer: ~w~Appreciate it, officer. I owe you one.
~b~Officer: ~w~All good here. Stay sharp out there!
~b~Officer: ~w~All wrapped up. Appreciate the assist!
~b~Officer: ~w~Thanks for having my back. Stay safe out there.
~b~Officer: ~w~Smooth one! See you on the next call.
~b~Officer: ~w~Thanks, sir! Always good having backup.
~b~Officer: ~w~Thanks, ma’am! Always good having backup.
